poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Boredom he says. He says it drills A wee hole in yr heid. No the third eye. Aye. No. Oh he does, dizzy? Aye And it dings down to bone and it says this is it - Which it isny, he says, ontologickly speaking. Dings doon the phone: disney like big words. Wanna thae bright sunny daze; A primrose digs itsel oot. A bee is, like, helicoptered in, Pinballs aroun, dizny get it; back to base. Did you order this day? Says my boss. Ay a did; Dim's the word, I said. Pay for it later.
